intro: Mesosphaerum plectranthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
